poem:
Title: Ode to the Unseen Stage

The Royal Court, a palace of dreams, dwindles,
In the gape of fiscal abyss.
Yet, the players dress in a sigh of words, 
Their script, a tale of lost sustenance. 
A new conductor seeks hope's octave,
In the dirge of feathered tenure's end.
An unseen stage beckons,
For the pen to birth the undiscovered,
In the bared tempest of biting austerity.
